head.supplied: Mongo ¶ 24/8/90. ¶ ¶ […] ¶ ¶ During last week I have succeeded in obtaining some more flowering specimens of Eriostemon Carruthersi, also fruiting specimens farther advanced than those obtained the ...

div.p: From Wilhelm Bäuerlen to Joseph Maiden
MRS 203/2, Inwards correspondence — special bundles, 1886-1921, 90/571, Archives of the Powerhouse Museum, Sydney

During last week I have succeeded in obtaining some more flowering specimens of Eriostemon Carruthersi, also fruiting specimens farther advanced than those obtained the week before, in fact nearly ripe. In the same locality, I came to a creek, where the shrub grows to a height of six feet, though very slender in stem, and there after much patient search, I succeeded in getting four quite ripe grains of seed; those, with some of the most advanced fruit, I have already forwarded to Baron von Muller, so that now the fruit of this species can be fully described. […]

I have also forwarded to the Baron pretty complete material of the Grevillea from the same locality, not yet described, so that he ought to be able now to determine whether it is really a new species or not. […]
